article_text:
At this dramatic time, with a world on fire, we look at the president and ponder again who he is. Mr. Obama himself mocked how people see him, according to a remarkable piece this week by Peter Baker in the New York Times. "Oh, it's a shame when you have a wan, diffident, professorial president," he reportedly said, sarcastically, in a meeting with journalists before his big Syria speech. Zbigniew Brzezinski told Mr. Baker the president's critics think he's a "a softy. He's not a softy."

Actually, no...

twitter.description: Is he weak? Arrogant? Ambivalent? Don't overthink the president, Peggy Noonan advises.
twitter.creator: @Peggynoonannyc

image.alt: The Unwisdom of Barack Obama by @peggynoonannyc

article_summary:
Zbigniew Brzezinski told Mr. Baker the president's critics think he's a "a softy.
Mr. Obama himself mocked how people see him, according to a remarkable piece this week by Peter Baker in the New York Times.
At this dramatic time, with a world on fire, we look at the president and ponder again who he is.
"Oh, it's a shame when you have a wan, diffident, professorial president," he reportedly said, sarcastically, in a meeting with journalists before his big Syria speech.
He's not a softy."
